RAB-0011_syn_1:
Indication: LLL nodules.
Proc: Ion bronch, Partial Reg, bx.
Findings: 1.4cm dominant nodule.
Action: Bx of both nodules. Aug fluoro.
Result: No complications.
RAB-0011_syn_2: OPERATIVE NOTE: The patient presented with clustered left lower lobe nodules. Robotic bronchoscopy (Ion) was performed using a partial registration strategy. The dominant 1.4 cm nodule was targeted first, showing a concentric REBUS view. Biopsies and brushings were taken. The smaller satellite nodule was also sampled along the same track. Augmented fluoroscopy confirmed positioning.
RAB-0011_syn_3:
CPT 31627 (Nav), 31654 (EBUS), 31628 (Bx), 31623 (Brush).
Note: Multiple lesions sampled in same lobe = single unit of 31628. Partial registration used for efficiency.

RAB-0011_syn_5: 61 female lll clustered nodules ion robot partial reg used navigated to big one 1.4cm concentric on rebus took biopsies and a brush then took bites of the little one too augmented fluoro confirmed tool in lesion no issues
RAB-0011_syn_6: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy with partial registration. LLL clustered nodules. Ion system used. REBUS showed concentric lesion. Augmented fluoroscopy used. Biopsies of both nodules obtained. No complications.
RAB-0011_syn_7:
[Indication]
Clustered LLL nodules.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Ion partial reg. Nav to LLL. REBUS concentric. Aug fluoro. Biopsies of dominant and satellite nodules.
[Plan]
Discharge. Path review.
RAB-0011_syn_8: We performed a robotic bronchoscopy on a 61-year-old female with clustered nodules in the left lower lobe. Using the Ion system with partial registration, we navigated to the dominant nodule. Radial EBUS showed a concentric view. We biopsied both the dominant and satellite nodules. The patient tolerated the procedure well.
RAB-0011_syn_9:
Indication: LLL nodules.
Method: Robotic steering (partial mapping), ultrasonic detection, tissue sampling.
Findings: 1.4cm concentric target.
Verification: Enhanced fluoroscopy.
Action: Acquired specimens from multiple sites. No hemorrhage.
RAB-0011: PATIENT: [REDACTED] 11, 61-year-old female. MRN: [REDACTED]. INDICATION FOR OPERATION: 61-year-old woman with two closely clustered nodules in the lateral basal left lower lobe measuring 1.1 and 1.4 cm, undergoing Ion robotic biopsy with partial registration. PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Multiple left lower lobe pulmonary nodules. POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same. PROCEDURE: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy using Intuitive Ion system (CPT 31627), radial EBUS (CPT 31654), transbronchial lung biopsy (CPT 31628), transbronchial brushing (CPT 31623). After general anesthesia and ETT, a partial ipsilateral registration (left tree) was performed. Navigation was directed to the dominant 1.4 cm nodule; radial EBUS showed a concentric lesion. Augmented fluoroscopy confirmed tool-in-lesion. Multiple forceps biopsies and a single brushing were obtained; the smaller adjacent nodule was sampled along the same trajectory with additional forceps passes. Bleeding was minimal and there were no complications.
